context: COVID-19 pandemic impact on storage market. Global external storage market revenue fell 8.2% year-over-year to $6.5B in Q1 2020 due to pandemic. Pure Storage was one of the few vendors performing well with revenue up 7.7% year-over-year, reaching $1.64B annual revenue with 7,500+ customers. Dell EMC rolled out PowerStore all-flash systems in 2020. HPE introduced new innovations for Primera and Nimble Storage with NVMe support and GreenLake as-a-service platform.

competitors.name: Dell EMC
competitors.notes: #1 competitor. Launched PowerStore all-flash systems for mid-range companies and enterprises in 2020. Broad portfolio including PowerMax and Unity XT series

competitors.name: NetApp
competitors.notes: Top external storage OEM. Revenue fell 8.2-20% in Q1 2020. Offers AFF series with unified data management across on-premises and cloud

competitors.name: HPE
competitors.notes: Top external storage OEM. Unveiled innovations for Primera and Nimble Storage in 2020 with NVMe, storage-class memory, and GreenLake as-a-service platform

competitors.name: Hitachi
competitors.notes: Top external storage OEM with Virtual Storage Platform. Revenue fell during pandemic

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Tied for 5th place with Pure Storage. FlashSystem portfolio with high-speed, all-flash and hybrid flash storage solutions

competitors.name: Huawei
competitors.notes: Tied for 5th place with Pure Storage in external storage market
